description.narrative: Laws, regulatory frameworks and services are put in place to adequately address children's access to justice, which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ General, Justice For Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved access to justice, social services and a minimum package of preventive and protective processes for Somali children, realized through a functional child protection system linked with comprehensive community based child protection mechanisms

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF INTERIOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND RECONCILIATION SOUTHWEST STATE OF SOMALIA

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Laws, regulatory frameworks and services are put in place to adequately address children?s access to justice

description.narrative: Good progress made on formulating legislation in line with the CRC. UNICEF supported Puntland authorities in finalizing the Juvenile Justice law that was enacted in 2017. On-going support is being provided to finalize these bills: Child Protection bill (Somaliland); Birth registration and Sexual Offences Bills (FGS, Puntland, Somaliland). | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: No. of child protection related legislative/policy /regulatory initiatives completed and operationalized in priority child protection areas (identified based on the assessment)

baseline.value: No policy/legal framework in place to ensure the right to family care and protection from violence in line with CRC

target.value: 2017:All three zones to enact or amend existing: 1. An Alternative care policy 2. FGM policy 3. Child Rights Act 4. JJ law 5. BR Act in NWZ and NEZ

actual.value: 2017:NEZ- Implementation plan on Juvenile Justice Act and Sexual Offence Act is underway- NWZ- development of Birth Registration Act and Justice Policy underway and Child Rights Bill is currently under review.- CSZ – Juvenile Justice Bill is being finalized and to be submitted to Cabinet and UNICEF wil
